result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Allan Kufahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other probation currently on

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with vitcim A.Z. unless allowed by agent.

Complete SAFE intake program with follow up. 
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 2:06pm
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears with Atty Peter Karoblis

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
Ct. 1 Battery- repeater- domestic abuse >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
Ct. 2 Disorderly conduct- repeater- domestic abuse >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 18 months probation, concurrent to any other probation currently on. CONDITIONS: Complete SAFE intake program with follow through. Pay CC. Pay one domestic abuse surcharge. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service per week. No contact with victim - A.Z., unless allowed by agent. Pay DNA sample and surcharge.

No contact with victim(s): A.Z.-NONWAIVABLE. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings. 3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
